text: it just all happened so quickly and in
you know I've been a police officer for
18 years and it just all just happened
just happened automatically really I
then you know there was no thought
process going on it just and in
hindsight it all seems very surreal
really thinking back to it it it it
almost feels like it wasn't real
everything was open the street the hard
cover was the bar and restaurant in
front of us so it seemed logical and
sensible to get everyone over there and
plus I could set the medic up over there
and it was somewhere safe I could put
him and get casualty to him because I
knew at that point ambulances we
wouldn't get EMS is up there anytime
soon because it's still live situation
we did that most get the medic in the
basement and there was a a couple of
other casualties which came a gentleman
had been stabbed in the stomach
he was taken downstairs to see the medic
and at that point and there were still
shots ringing out and then a stream of
people came out the market running and
screaming so then we literally just
pushed them into the basement the pub
and it's quite a big venue and it seemed
like the safest place to to put a large
volume of people at that time that were
serves out of harm's way
I could hear other colleagues up on
London Bridge on the radio calling for
ambulances urgently and saying they were
doing CPR and I've got a report from my
medic saying that their casualties we
had were not critical at that point and
we acquired another police medic from
somewhere they know where he came from
be shelled with my medic and I decided
we needed to get go the medics up the
London Bridge but I had to find some
armed officers to go with them because I
think though what was going on that
point and that took a little bit of time
to get a couple of armed officers and
then they went running off up there to
out with the casualties up on the bridge
